responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Weak Cryptographic Algorithm in Password Hashing"
    analysis: |
      The code utilizes an insufficient cryptographic algorithm for password hashing (`iuneD4hXPQImdHQSRE0aOcRF`), which could potentially be brute-forced or cracked using modern hardware, thereby compromising user credentials and allowing unauthorized access.
    cwe: CWE-327
    function_names:
      - init
    filenames:
      - /CONTENTS OF index.html
    classification: very promising
```

```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Vulnerability in JavaScript Code for Lunr Languages"
    analysis: |
      The lunr language files, part of a JavaScript static site search index library, contain a common pattern of introducing potential vulnerabilities due to regular expressions. These files use pattern matching to handle different types of inputs which can be exploited to cause denial of service (DoS) via Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks. Specifically, the regex patterns used are susceptible to exhausting system resources causing the application to crash when handling crafted inputs that form long execution times.
    cwe: CWE-400
    function_names:
      - parse
    filenames:
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.ro.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.jp.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.multi.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.stemmer.support.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.fr.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.tr.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.es.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.da.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.ru.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.hu.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.no.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.fi.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/lunr.du.js
      - docs/assets/javascripts/lunr/tinyseg.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm in Password Hashing
leads.analysis: The code utilizes an insufficient cryptographic algorithm for password hashing (iuneD4hXPQImdHQSRE0aOcRF), which could potentially be brute-forced or cracked using modern hardware, thereby compromising user credentials and allowing unauthorized access.

leads.headline: Vulnerability in JavaScript Code for Lunr Languages
leads.analysis: The lunr language files, part of a JavaScript static site search index library, contain a common pattern of introducing potential vulnerabilities due to regular expressions. These files use pattern matching to handle different types of inputs which can be exploited to cause denial of service (DoS) via Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks. Specifically, the regex patterns used are susceptible to exhausting system resources causing the application to crash when handling crafted inputs that form long execution times.
